channel.title: Homes on Statsbylopez
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Statsbylopez

item.description: Biography Michael Lopez is the Director of Football Data and Analytics at the National Football League and a Lecturer of Statistics and Research Associate at Skidmore College. At the National Football League, his work centers on how to use data to enhance and better understand the game of football. Academically, his research is split between causal inference – with a specific focus on causal inference methods for multiple exposures or multiple exposure doses – and the application of statistics to sports.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I taught the following courses at Skidmore College: MS 104: Intro to Statistics MS 204: Statistical Methods (Github) MS 210: Data Visualization and storytelling (Github) MA 204: Probability (Github) MS 276: Statistics and Sports (Github) MS 376: Mathematical Statistics MS 240: Regression
